## Coding Standards

### Naming Conventions
- Use PascalCase for classes and type definitions
- Use camelCase for functions, variables, and methods
- Use SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE for constants
- Prefix private members with underscore (_)

### Code Organization
- Keep files focused and under 300 lines
- Group related functionality together
- Separate concerns into logical modules

### Error Handling
- Never silently catch errors
- Use typed error classes when appropriate
- Log errors with contextual information

### Documentation
- Write self-documenting code
- Comment on *why*, not *what*
- Include JSDoc/docstrings for public APIs

## Testing Requirements
<!-- Define your testing expectations -->
- Write tests for all new functionality
- Target [X]% code coverage
- Use [test framework] for unit tests
- Mock external dependencies
